p: Political barriers: Concomitantly, rural LHDs may be politically constrained from dedicating resources to climate change adaptation. Elected rural officials in the western United States showed less support for and/or neutrality toward existing federal environmental policies [21], fueled by constituency distrust in government oversight [21]. Sentiments of marginalization may fuel rural distrust of government entities [22], providing unfavorable political environments for LHDs to prioritize climate change adaptation activities [23].
